title: What is the value of the estate
question: What are the values of the estate for Inheritance Tax?
questionHint:
If you do not have these values, use the IHT checker to get them. We collect these values for HMRC so they can check if you need pay inheritance tax.

The gross, net and net qualifying values must be a whole number and must not include decimals, full stops or commas. For example, 6000
estateGrossValueHint: This is the total value of all assets like property, money and gifts in the last 7 years before taking off any debts
estateNetValueHint: Take off any debts like mortgage and credit cards from the gross value
estateNetQualifyingValueHint: Take off from the net value any assets passed to spouse or civil partner and money left to a charity.
forEstateIht: for the estate for inheritance tax in £
